title: Which one is more basic, OsO₄ or ReO₂? - Quora

response.answer_text: Neither. Both are acidic in character, because they react aqueous alkali. In particular, OsO₄ is a volatile, covalent solid, in spite of being a metal oxide (osmium has a formal oxidation state of +8):OsO₄(s) + 2OH¯(aq) → [OsO₄(OH)₂]²¯(aq) ReO₂ is a solid with an extended network of rutile-like metal-oxygen bonds:ReO₂(s) + 2OH¯(aq) → ReO₃²¯(aq) + H₂O(l)
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Boateng Danso Isaac
